intro: Rhinocidium welteri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with upright stems and dense foliage. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Rhinocidium welteri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
